text:
I’ve tried setting up things in the past it’s a real pain, i’m not sure if there are any good solutions yet.

All emails force you to include a link to the HubSpot subscription preferences page, so you will need to set a template up in hubpsot, But you may be able to change this template so it redirects the users to your own page,

I’ve also struggled in the past using the api’s to unsubscribe or resubscribe users.

I think the subscription preferences page is like a deep seated backbone of what HubSpot was 10 years ago, and updates since have all but woven this into a complicated untangle-able web and no one from HubSpot want’s to touch it with a barge pole, out of fear of destroying the custom setups people have built over the years. Obviously also a huge GDPR issue too.

If you do get somewhere though it would be good to know what you ended up doing

Hi All I am trying to convince you customer communication team to move back to HubSpot from Iterable. One of the blockers is that they have become big fans of the possibility to write IF statements directly in them template. I know that you can do smart content but this is very time consuming and we don't have any access controls over lists. Do you know if you can do something similar in HubSpot?
